ref: 9358 bhaṅgurá ʻ crooked ʼ (in bhaṅgurāˊvant -- ʻ having crooked ways ʼ RV.), ʻ bent, curled ʼ Kathās., m. ʻ bend in a river ʼ lex. 2. ʻ fragile, breakable ʼ Kāv. [Like bhaṅgi -- , it belongs to a non -- Aryan word -- group (PMWS 88) for ʻ crooked, bent ʼ in vaṅka -- 1, vaṅkú -- , vaṅkara -- 1, perh. identical with more general ʻ defective ʼ words s.v. *vaṅka -- 2, cf. bhaṅgurá -- ~ paṅgú -- , paṅgula -- . Mng. ʻ breakable ʼ from association with bhaṅga -- 1. Also bhaga -- 2 ʻ vulva ʼ (with poss. variation *bagha -- , see bhaginī -- ) may belong here, either as ʻ bend, curve ʼ or as general ʻ defective ʼ word, such as in so many cases provides sexual terms]
A. bheṅur ʻ a bend ʼ, bheṅurā ʻ crooked ʼ (for -- e -- cf. ʻ defective ʼ *bhēṅga -- ).
